adrFormatAddress: 104 W 29th St 6th floor, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: I worked with Zack at Galerie Shabab. I was looking for a difficult to find size , quality, design and color rug for my bedroom. Zack was so patient and knowledgeable. He answered all my questions...and I had many. As a result I bought a beautiful Baluch and couldn't be happier with my decision. You can absolutely feel comfortable trusting Zack and Galerie Shabab with your high end rug purchase online.

originalText.text: The best place in NYC to find antique and vintage rugs. My girlfriend and I recently purchased our living room rug from Galerie Shabab. We worked with Zack, who was incredibly helpful. We showed him a photo of something we were using as inspiration, and Zack was able to work through their inventory to find a piece that fit our exact needs - price, size, and character. If you are looking for a quality, one of a kind rug, this is the first place I would go.

originalText.text: Galerie Shabab and Zack Ebrat are in a class of their own. Over the last three years I’ve been on a rug-buying frenzy of sorts, purchasing a variety of styles from an equally diverse selection of dealers. A couple come close to Zack’s quality and care, but he most definitely excels with a unique combination of genuine helpfulness and integrity enhanced by an excellent inventory. The experience is always a total pleasure.

originalText.text: I found Galerie Shabab online so I was a bit leery but Zack and the Shari , the owner, couldn't have been more professional. They provided me with the information on the background of the particular rug, a khotan, that I was interested in. There was no pressure to buy the rug and offered alternative choices. I visited their gallery in Manhattan that was spotless and they had the rug I was interested in already laid out for me to view. The rug is gorgeous, clean and came with a pad to put underneath it. They also were willing to take it back if it didn't work in the space that I needed it for. They shipped it for free and it arrived the next day like they had indicated.

originalText.text: All hand-woven, Shabab offers a vast selection of sizes, colors, prices, designs, alongside what is clearly a comprehensive knowledge of antique rugs.  The biggest problem I had was holding myself back from buying more than one rug!  What I appreciated more than anything was the presence of Zack, who from the beginning was welcoming, helpful,  and ever responsive to all the many questions and concerns.  My feeling is that in New York City, one can buy a rug many places, but what matters to me is finding a place where the provenance of the rug is known (if possible) and valued, and also, a place where the people selling the rugs really know and appreciate these antiques.  I look forward to returning to Shabab as soon as I can afford another rug.  Many thanks and much appreciation to Zack!
